data.title: Lisa Laporte on LinkedIn: Writing is back on TWiT.tv! Our hosts and AI made it easier for us toâ€¦
data.meta_description: Writing is back on TWiT.tv! Our hosts and AI made it easier for us to include the written word when it's relevant to complement our podcasts. Check it outâ€¦
data.text:
How many important internal documents go unread? Answer: Make a podcast. Great GenAI use case from Claire Vo: 1. Identify important internal docs (FAQs, PRDs, feature memos, competitive briefings) 2. Use GPT4 to convert them into podcast scripts (bonus if you reframe a competitive battle card in the theme of a medieval battle) 3. Use a service like ElevenLabs to convert the text into soothing audio for easy consumption Takes 5 min and will instantly increase the ROI of the time you spent building those darn docs.

What is the key ingredient to coming up with a successful cross-promo between podcasts? On our blog, you can find out the tips and tricks to identifying a good trade partner, all while keeping your listener in mind. Check it out here:

From podcasts to books to your Apple Watch, the term VO2 max is popping up everywhere. But what is it? And why should you care about it? Let me explain in this monthâ€™s Coachâ€™s Corner. Click here to read: https://lnkd.in/geAqrGKM

What does the science say about Tail Wagging? Check it out on The Science Pawdcast, our wholesome science show that breaks down Pet and Human Science every week! Find it on: Apple Podcasts, Goodpods, Spotify, and literally everywhere else!

This is a cool new service. Podwise is an AI note taking app for podcasts. It takes notes, gives you summaries, and topics discussed without you having to listen yourself. Great for research, discovery, optimization, etc. Try it out https://podwise.xyz/i/14e

Google Core Updates - how often do they happen, and why? Tilly takes us through the basics in this bite-sized snippet. Listen to the full recording wherever you get your podcasts ðŸŽ§
